member.name: T:ZS.Common.Monitor.MONITORINFO
member.summary: The MONITORINFO structure contains information about a display monitor. The GetMonitorInfo function stores information in a MONITORINFO structure or a MONITORINFOEX structure. The MONITORINFO structure is a subset of the MONITORINFOEX structure. The MONITORINFOEX structure adds a string member to contain a name for the display monitor.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Monitor.MONITORINFO.cbSize
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes. Set this member to sizeof ( MONITORINFO ) before calling the GetMonitorInfo function. Doing so lets the function determine the type of structure you are passing to it.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Monitor.MONITORINFO.rcMonitor
member.summary: A RECT structure that specifies the display monitor rectangle, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates. Note that if the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Monitor.MONITORINFO.rcWork
member.summary: A RECT structure that specifies the work area rectangle of the display monitor, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates. Note that if the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

member.summary: A set of flags that represent attributes of the display monitor.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Structures.Rectangle.RECT.left
member.summary: The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Structures.Rectangle.RECT.top
member.summary: The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Structures.Rectangle.RECT.right
member.summary: The x-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Structures.Rectangle.RECT.bottom

member.name: T:ZS.Common.Structures.Window.MINMAXINFO
member.summary: Contains information about a window's maximized size and position and its minimum and maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Structures.Window.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxSize
member.summary: The maximized width (x member) and the maximized height (y member) of the window. For top-level windows, this value is based on the width of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Structures.Window.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxPosition
member.summary: The position of the left side of the maximized window (x member) and the position of the top of the maximized window (y member). For top-level windows, this value is based on the position of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Structures.Window.MINMAXINFO.ptMinTrackSize
member.summary: he minimum tracking width (x member) and the minimum tracking height (y member) of the window. This value can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMINTRACK and SM_CYMINTRACK (see the GetSystemMetrics function).

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Structures.Window.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxTrackSize
member.summary: The maximum tracking width (x member) and the maximum tracking height (y member) of the window. This value is based on the size of the virtual screen and can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMAXTRACK and SM_CYMAXTRACK (see the GetSystemMetrics function).

member.name: M:ZS.Common.Win32API.MonitorFromWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The MonitorFromWindow function retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the bounding rectangle of a specified window.
member.param: A handle to the window of interest.

Determines the function's return value if the window does not intersect any display monitor. This parameter can be one of the following values: MONITOR_DEFAULTTONEAREST:Returns a handle to the display monitor that is nearest to the window. MONITOR_DEFAULTTONULL:Returns NULL. MONITOR_DEFAULTTOPRIMARY:Returns a handle to the primary display monitor.
member.returns: If the window intersects one or more display monitor rectangles, the return value is an HMONITOR handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the window. If the window does not intersect a display monitor, the return value depends on the value of dwFlags.
member.remarks: If the window is currently minimized, MonitorFromWindow uses the rectangle of the window before it was minimized.

member.name: M:ZS.Common.Win32API.GetMonitorInfo(System.IntPtr,ZS.Common.Structures.Monitors.MONITORINFO@)
member.summary: The GetMonitorInfo function retrieves information about a display monitor.
member.param: A handle to the display monitor of interest.

A pointer to a MONITORINFO or MONITORINFOEX structure that receives information about the specified display monitor. You must set the cbSize member of the structure to sizeof(MONITORINFO) or sizeof(MONITORINFOEX) before calling the GetMonitorInfo function. Doing so lets the function determine the type of structure you are passing to it. The MONITORINFOEX structure is a superset of the MONITORINFO structure. It has one additional member: a string that contains a name for the display monitor. Most applications have no use for a display monitor name, and so can save some bytes by using a MONITORINFO structure.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.summary: 输入设备

member.name: T:ZS.Common.Win32Messages.Messages
member.summary: 系统消息值定义

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Win32Messages.Messages.WM_NCHITTEST
member.summary: Sent to a window in order to determine what part of the window corresponds to a particular screen coordinate. This can happen, for example, when the cursor moves, when a mouse button is pressed or released, or in response to a call to a function such as WindowFromPoint. If the mouse is not captured, the message is sent to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is sent to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Win32Messages.Messages.WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Win32Messages.Messages.WM_GETMINMAXINFO
member.summary: Sent to a window when the size or position of the window is about to change. An application can use this message to override the window's default maximized size and position, or its default minimum or maximum tracking size. 当窗体的尺寸或者位置发生改变时发送给窗体。 应用程序可以使用该消息重写窗体的默认最大尺寸或者位置，或者最小/最大的可拉伸尺寸。

member.name: T:ZS.Common.Win32Messages.EnumMESSAGES
member.summary: Windows消息枚举

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Win32Messages.EnumMESSAGES.WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Win32Messages.NCHITTEST.HTBOTTOMRIGHT

member.summary: On the screen background or on a dividing line between windows (same as HTNOWHERE, except that the DefWindowProc function produces a system beep to indicate an error).

member.name: F:ZS.Common.Win32Messages.NCHITTEST.HTMENU
member.summary: In a menu.
